adjectives.description: wrecked (comparative more wrecked, superlative most wrecked)

entries.meaning: Destroyed, usually in an accident; damaged to the point of unusability.
(slang) Very intoxicated from alcohol or recreational drugs.
examples: […]  just thought she was wrecked from all the Diamond White ciders she'd been sinking – I'd even bought her a couple of Blastaways, which in hindsight was a mistake.

entries.meaning: (Internet slang) Having been put in a dreadful or embarrassing situation; can range from being pwned in a game to being utterly defeated in an argument or publicly shamed with a stinging insult.
simple past tense and past participle of wreck
